supporting_text: The NAP addresses health human, animal health, control fitosanitario, and its impact on the environment.
The NAP includes actions to optimize the use of antimicrobials in human health.
The NAP includes actions to optimize the use of antimicrobials in animal health.
The NAP addresses the impact of antimicrobial resistance on the environment.
The NAP includes actions related to the use of antimicrobials in agriculture and food security.
The NAP outlines the establishment of a governance table for monitoring and evaluation.
The NAP includes indicators of effectiveness for each strategic line.
The NAP includes levels of reduction in antimicrobial consumption and resistance incidence.
The NAP does not specify budget allocations.
The NAP does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The NAP establishes a governance table for AMR coordination.
The NAP includes regulations for the manufacturing and dispensing of antimicrobials.
The NAP includes actions to incorporate AMR awareness in educational programs.
The NAP includes strategies for public awareness campaigns regarding AMR.
The NAP is aligned with international initiatives from WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP includes the establishment of integrated surveillance systems for AMR.
The NAP includes actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting AMR.
The NAP includes strategies for sanitation and infection prevention.
The NAP aligns with international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP includes regulations to promote the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the need for international collaboration in research for new antimicrobials.
